page.title: 11THE ELECTRICITY BOARD
page.content: The Southern Electricity Board has an office in Yarnton.There are 13 other offices in Southern England.The Southern Electricity Board's job is to buy and distribute electricity from the National Grid.The Yarnton office was built in the late 1960s and was opened in 1972.Now 550 people work there, although a decade ago one thousand people worked there.There are 200 vehicles and 6 petrol pumps. The land it was built on was lowland swamp.They bought it for Â£600 although it is on top of valuable gravel.
